name: Gabriel Engel
short_biography: Creating the platform for human collaboration over the Internet, powered by the global open source community.
long_biography:
Gabriel Engel is the founder of Rocket.Chat. Rocket.Chat is the leading open source team collaboration platform that allows users to chat securely on the web, desktop, or mobile; featuring extensive interoperability options with most major open source and commercial messaging platforms.

Gabriel founded Rocket.Chat in 2015 and is passionate about open source and emerging technologies that empowers humanity to better collaborate over the Internet. Prior to Rocket.Chat, Gabriel co-founded Konecty, and worked as Product Manager for Business Innovation and Mobile Applications at Vodafone Global Enterprise. Gabrielâ€™s long-term vision for Rocket.Chat is to replace email with a real-time user friendly federated communications platform.

name: Rodrigo Nascimento
long_biography: Rodrigo co-founded Rocket.Chat in 2015 and is passionate about collaboration tools, programming, open source and new tech. Prior to Rocket.Chat, Rodrigo worked for Konecty as Full-Stack Developer and founded Carddi, a startup aiming to bring the restaurants information close to the people.

name: Sing Li
short_biography: Creating the platform for human collaboration over the Internet, powered by the global open source community.
long_biography: Sing Li is a dynamic leader with a wealth of experience in building and managing communities. As the Chief Opportunities Officer of RocketChat, he is responsible for identifying and seizing new opportunities for growth and expansion. In addition to his role at RocketChat, Sing is also the Community Manager of Google Summer of Code, where he works to connect students with open-source projects and mentors. With his deep understanding of the open-source landscape and his ability to bring people together, Sing is a valuable asset to any team.

name: Duda Nogueira
short_biography: After decades working and promoting Open Source in different industries and countries, Duda recently joined Rocket.Chat as our Community Manager. He is driven by the joy of integrating people and technology into innovative solutions.

name: Douglas Gubert
short_biography: Tech Lead @RocketChat | Might worry a bit too much about code styling and semantics ðŸ¤“
long_biography: Douglas is a Tech Lead at Rocket.Chat. When he is not coding and worrying about developer experience and code semantics, he is studying random (human) languages or playing video-games with his kid (or by himself)

name: Devanshu Sharma
short_biography: Rocket.Chat intern and an undergraduate student exploring and contributing towards his goal of creating Open Source (OS) web projects.
long_biography: Devanshu is a GSoC Alumnus of Rocket.Chat, and currently the lead developer of RC4Conferences, a powerful set of components that allow communities to host virtual conferences of any size. With a deep understanding of the needs and challenges faced by diverse community members, Devanshu works to improve the platform and make it more accessible to everyone. In addition to his work on web projects, Devanshu is also passionate about exploring cutting-edge technologies like machine learning, decentralized web, and the Metaverse. If you''re looking for a scalable and flexible solution for your virtual conference needs, be sure to check out RC4Conferences on GitHub -> RC4Conferences.

name: Sidharth Mohanty
short_biography: Fullstack engineer at Memorang | Building Jugyah | GSoC 2023 mentor and 2022 contributor at RocketChat
long_biography: I am Sidharth Mohanty, a 2nd year CSE undergraduate at Odisha University of Technology and Research (Formerly CET), Bhubaneswar, India. I am a full stack developer who likes to turn ideas into life. With a keen interest of learning new technologies, I also have a drive to solve real world problems. I have contributed to various open source projects and have created some myself. Coding, gymming and reading books are my love triangle. If I have to describe myself in one word it would be - ''explorer''.

name: Fongang Rodrique
short_biography: A technical writer, Cyber security enthusiast and No Code developer
long_biography: A computer engineering graduate from the university of Buea, a Rocket.Chat GSoC alumni and currently a Technical writer at Rocket.Chat. Deeply interested in cyber security and also a creative photographer.

name: Mustafa Hasan Khan
short_biography: CSE Sophomore, self taught programmer since 2011, fintech and blockchain enthusiast.
long_biography: I am Mustafa Hasan Khan, currently pursuing my Bachelors in Computer Science and Technology. I''ve been close to computers since an early age, and been passionate about tech ever since. I started in 2010 with no-code tools, and from that, I explored how to code myself, fast-forward to today, I do programming in various languages and technologies. Fintech and Blockchain intrigues me the most, I believe these both tech domains will be revolutionary for the world in this century. I am an avid gamer too, in my free time I play and stream on my gaming channel @ZampGaming

name: Dhruv Jain
short_biography: Software Engineer @ Gojek | Rocket.Chat GSoC Alumni
long_biography: I am a software engineer at Gojek in the Gofood labs division which primarily focuses on integrating real-time use cases using MQTT protocol within the GoTo ecosystem(Gojek, Tokopedia, and Goto Financials)

name: Murtaza Patrawala
long_biography: Meet Murtaza, a software developer and former GSoC student who loves creating customer-focused apps and building solutions. When not coding, Murtaza enjoys traveling and hiking to new places. Join Murtaza for a playful and informative session on GSoC and gain insights from his experience.
